pageContext.claim: “Many people currently a part of my opposition, including President Obama & the Dems, have had campaign violations, in some cases for very large sums of money. These are civil cases. They paid a fine & settled. While no big deal, I did not commit a campaign violation!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is mixing apples and oranges here. The Obama campaign paid a fine for relatively minor reporting violations to the Federal Election Commission. The Obama campaign’s violation was a civil infraction of campaign finance law, which resulted in an administrative penalty. Trump attorney Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to a deliberate effort to violate campaign finance law, which is a crime.
